hierarchical clustering with spatial soft constraints

Source: R/stratification.R
hclustgeo_disc.Rd

hierarchical clustering with spatial soft constraints

Usage

hclustgeo_disc(sfj, n, alpha = 0.5, scale = TRUE, wt = NULL, ...)

Arguments

sfj

An sf object.

n

The number of hierarchical clustering classes, which can be a numeric value or vector.

alpha

(optional) A real value between 0 and 1. This mixing parameter gives the relative importance of "feature" space and constraint" space. Default is 0.5.

scale

(optional) Whether to scaled the dissimilarities matrix, default is TRUE.

wt

(optional) Vector with the weights of the observations. By default, wt is NULL.

...

(optional) Other arguments passed to stats::dist().

Value

A vector with group memberships if n are scalar, otherwise a matrix with group memberships is returned where each column corresponds to the elements of n, respectively.

Examples

gzma = sf::read_sf(system.file('extdata/gzma.gpkg',package = 'sdsfun'))
gzma$group = hclustgeo_disc(gzma,5, alpha = 0.75)
plot(gzma["group"])
